Annotation.note:
The chords $PA$, $PB$, $PC$ of a given circle are the diameters of three circles $(PA)$, $(PB)$, $(PC)$. The circle $(PA)$ meets the lines $PB$, $PC$ in the points $D$, $G$, the circle $(PB)$ meets $PA$, $PC$ in $E$, $H$, the circle $(PC)$ meets $PA$, $PB$ in $F$, $I$. Show that the three lines $DG$, $EH$, $FI$ are concurrent.
\begin{keywords} geometry theorem proving \end{keywords}
